column2: JSinMD, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This was my savior! I had chronic sinus infections to the point I could not lift my head or turn my head.  I was seeing a doctor who kept giving me antibiotics weekly and I asked after a year what if its allergies. He said maybe.... Quack!The new doctor tried me on Allegra-D and I have been Sinus Infection free knock on wood since the mid 90s.I hope I never get immune to this like I am to almost all antibiotics. I can only take a hand full of antibiotics now.I was having problems yesterday and I took another one and was feeling like my self again. Someone had called in a 12hr one aday and that's not enouht. I can not afford to get an infection again. Good Luck to you.Live by it!

column2: K_W, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: ~ The sleep problems go away after a few days! ~ This has been a miracle drug for my sinus and allergy problems! I was having severe sinus headaches - that felt like migraines - probably 25 days out of the month. I tried EVERYTHING (prescription, over-the-counter, and even natural remedies) but nothing worked. I was miserable until my doctor prescribed Allegra D-24 hour. My constant headache was gone about an hour or two after taking my first dose and now I rarely ever get a sinus headache. I had problems sleeping for the first 3-5 nights after I started taking it. I started taking the medicine earlier and earlier until I was taking it first thing in the morning. (You have to take it 1 hour before eating or 2 hours after eating.) If you can hang in there past those first few nights of trouble sleeping (take a sleeping pill or something to relax you) you will feel so much better! It was totally worth the adjustment period for me! I have no side effects at all now. And, in fact, it will help wake you up a little in the morning if you take it then. I am so glad my doctor prescribed this because after trying at least 10 other medications this is the only thing that has helped me. Side note: I was recently prescribed Astilin nasal spray as well and that works wonders too! I am not a doctor, just a patient, but I definitely recommend both for severe sinus/allergy problems.
